1299671.name: Full of Love Fidget Muff
1299671.notes_html:
Designed for a dear adult with cognitive disability, the interior of this muff is soft, warm, and full of interesting texture. It entices the user to keep their hands warm and includes a “secret” message: “We Love You” written in a textured translation of Morse Code.

The high contrast, graphic pattern on the outside is visually stimulating to young children as well. The exterior is designed with food-grade silicone beads positioned and secured to offer fidget activities that are safe and engaging.

This muff is worked in-the-round with right sides for final inside and outside facing the right side of the work.

Gauge is not critical. Adjustments to pattern can be made in increments of 8 stitches.

Special Supplies:
~15 food-grade silicone beads

Shapes and sizes may vary. Use whatever color, size, and shapes you like!
https://www.amazon.com/s?k=silicone+beads+variety+pack&am...

1301689.name: Grief Therapy Doll
1301689.notes_html:
While struggling with complex feelings it sometimes helps to have a therapy doll to hold, cry with, scream at - as catalyst for everything you need to release from your heart.

I have created this Grief doll in my own process to release sadness and everything that goes with it. It helped a lot!

Here is a pattern for you to crochet a therapy doll like this.
It took me about 5hours to create one.

You will need:

Crochet hook

  • 2,5 mm (US size C/2; UK size 12)
  • 6 mm (US size J/10; UK size 4)

Yarn:

  • Alize Cotton Gold Black code: 60
  • Alize Decofur Sim Grey code: 2101
  • Alize Cotton Gold Grey code: 21

Fiberfill
Yarn Needle
Scisors

1338424.name: Breast (3 nipple styles)
1338424.notes_html:
Beginner level. Perfect model for lactation classes and consultants. This pattern includes instruction on 3 different nipple types: standard, flat and inverted.

You Need:
• Hook, size I (5.5mm)
• PolyFill
• Main Color, worsted weight yarn
• Nipple Color, worsted weight yarn
• Please note, this pattern is written in the round with no slip stitch at the end of each round. When you reach step 2, follow which nipple style you’re trying to make. Either 2a, 2b or 2c.

Beginner level. Perfect model for lactation classes and consultants. This pattern includes instruction on 3 different nipple types: standard, flat and inverted.


You Need:

•	Nipple Color, worsted weight yarn
•	Please note, this pattern is written in the round with no slip stitch at the end of each round. When you reach step 2, follow which nipple style you’re trying to make. Either 2a, 2b or 2c.

1340638.name: Soothing Sensory Squares
1340638.gauge_description: 8 stitches and 4.5 rows = 4 inches in Double Crochet
1340638.notes_html:
These soothing squares can be used by any age to help regulate breathing and refocus the mind. From hypnobirthing, teaching toddlers to self-regulate, or even helping with anxious teens, these squares are a silent, tactile item that can discretely be kept in a pocket.

I have suggested materials below, but you can make this with any yarn and hook size - it just depends how big or small a square you wish to create.

This pattern is written in US terminology.

The links are affiliate links and will take you to LoveCrafts. It costs you no extra than buying it normally, but I will make a small amount from the sale if you do purchase any materials through the link.

There is an option to make either a square or a rectangle. The square is used for 4 x 4 breathing, the rectangle is 4 x 8.

You will need either 20g or 40g of Aran weight Cotton yarn. I use a 4.00mm hook but you may wish to use bigger hooks depending on your tension.

1343155.name: Feelings
1343155.sizes_available: The quiet book is designed as an approximately 20cm x 20cm square book.
1343155.notes_html:
Sensory items offer a gentle yet effective way to help individuals connect with their surroundings and help enhance feelings of well-being. They’re are not just potentially therapeutic but also a way to help promote fine motor skills and sensory awareness. Each page offering a subtle yet impactful way to engage individuals.

It uses US terminology.

Skill level - Easy Peasy, with a few tricksy spots.

Material List

  • Yarn weight – DK Acrylic yarn (thin kind). I used odd balls of variegated, plain colours and cakes.
  • Hook size – 4mm.
  • Needle for needle join and sewing in ends.
  • Stitch markers.
  • Beads – 27 x 5mm.
  • Pom-pom (I made mine over a fork) or a 25mm button.
  • Ribbon/cord – 70cm length x 6mm wide.
  • Wooden donut beads – 8 x 25mm or keyrings.
  • Cat brush.
  • Buttons – 5 x 15mm.
  • Press studs – 3 x 15mm or 18mm.
  • Buttons – 6 x 12mm.
  • Beads – 116 x 6mm.
  • Thin cardboard – 1 x sheet (A4 size).
  • Acetate – 1 x sheet (A4 size).
  • Photograph or picture.
  • Photo corners – 4 x corners or glue.
  • Ribbon (to tie up the book) – 14 x 90cm lengths (different colours and thicknesses), charms and bells, or you could make use of two pieces of cord (90cm long).

In the prelude (beginning pages) of the pattern you will find detailed stitch tutorials, yarn quantities used and many many more bits of useful info!

You are more than welcome to work Feelings in any yarn of your choice. However, depending on the yarn and tension, you may have a size difference.

The pattern does not have step-by-step photo tutorials.

Visit our Facebook group for pattern support and other info: https://www.facebook.com/groups/1370975902929963/

charms and bells, or you could make use of two pieces of cord (90cm long).

In the prelude (beginning pages) of the pattern you will find detailed stitch tutorials, yarn quantities used and many many more bits of useful info!

You are more than welcome to work Feelings in any yarn of your choice. However, depending on the yarn and tension, you may have a size difference.

1353973.name: Infinity Fidget cube
1353973.yarn_weight_description: Any gauge - designed for any gauge
1353973.notes_html:
The crochet pattern is in English. After buying, you need to download the file. The scheme will come to you in the form of a pdf file, which is convenient to view from your phone, computer, tablet or print if necessary. The pattern is easy to follow thanks to the step-by-step detailed instructions accompanied by photos. (There are 11 pages of text with photos illustrating the process). This pattern is designed by me. Having the pattern gives you the right to crochet the toy, give it as a gift, or sell it. The only restriction is the distribution of the pattern - the pattern may not be sold, published, exchanged, transferred or passed on in any form! You can link to my store so that other users can recognize me.

Materials and tools you will need to create a toy:
Yarn:
-YarnArt Jeans 75 (blue)
-YarnArt Jeans 72 (purple)
-YarnArt Jeans 53 (light green)
-YarnArt Jeans 23 (carrot)
-YarnArt Jeans 88 (yellow)
-YarnArt Jeans 73 (peach)
-Alize Cotton Gold 55 (white)
-Crochet hook No. 2

  • Holofiber filler
  • Sewing needle -Scissors -Iron with steam function (optional) You can use other colors of yarn that you like.

Please note that this pattern does not contain crochet lessons! You must have basic crochet skills!

7287463.name: Twiddlemuff
7287463.notes_html:
A very close friend of mine was recently diagnosed with dementia. I remember our many nature hikes with his dog, and decided to knit a twiddle muff to keep his active hands busy.

I used scraps of different weights and qualities and attached pictures of sample yarn strands and the felt dog pattern. I had lost most yarn bands and made my choices by colour and texture mostly, to make the muff most interesting to look at and to touch. I used yarn thicknesses reaching from DK to chunky and needle sizes of US 1 - 2 (metric 2.5 mm) , US 4 (metric 3.5 mm) and US 8 (metric 5 mm).

The pattern consists of knit and purl stitches, bobbles, stranded colour work, slipped stitches and yarn overs. The muff is knitted in the flat and the edges are joined after completion.

In my opinion, this pattern is suitable for intermediate knitters. Each step is explained here (I included stitch techniques and dog making and finishing instructions), and I am happy to help with any questions.

I hope you enjoy creating a similar muff, they are one-in-a-million pieces and will make someone you know very happy and much less anxious. Enjoy and happy knitting!
7287463.notes:
A very close friend of mine was recently diagnosed with dementia. I remember our many nature hikes with his dog, and decided to knit a twiddle muff to keep his active hands busy. 

I used scraps of different weights and qualities and attached pictures of sample yarn strands and the felt dog pattern. I had lost most yarn bands and made my choices by colour and texture mostly, to make the muff most interesting to look at and to touch. I used yarn thicknesses reaching from DK to chunky and needle sizes of US 1 - 2 (metric 2.5 mm) , US 4 (metric 3.5 mm) and US 8 (metric 5 mm).

The pattern consists of knit and purl stitches, bobbles, stranded colour work, slipped stitches and yarn overs. The muff is knitted in the flat and the edges are joined after completion. 

In my opinion, this pattern is suitable for intermediate knitters. Each step is explained here (I included stitch techniques and dog making and finishing instructions), and I am happy to help with any questions. 

I hope you enjoy creating a similar muff, they are one-in-a-million pieces and will make someone you know very happy and much less anxious. Enjoy and happy knitting!

users.about_me:
Hi!

I’m Anja Sammon, the designer behind JulchenKnits. I trained as a tailor in my native Germany and now work as Art teacher in a public school on the West coast of Ireland. 

Watching my mum knit as a child seemed like magic to me. She taught me how to knit when I was seven years old, and this is where my website name “Julchen knits” was born: “Julchen”(or "Yool-hen")  is a German pet name for mischievous little girls, and as I would often be seen with my knitting perched on the kitchen counter, someone would surely say “Guck, Julchen strickt wieder!” – “Look, Julchen knits again!” 

2022 was my "Brioche Year", taking inspiration from art historical designs with prominant lines and textures. This year, in 2023, I am researching traditional stitch patterns and colour combinations from my local area in Germany, which has some of the oldest "Trachten" on record, and combine these with our Irish Aran stitches. 

Knitting for me is all about community, fun and trying something new each day. Please get in touch at any time to ask questions, suggest ideas, collab, or simply to chat. I would love to hear from you. 

Happy knitting! :)
users.about_me_html:
Hi!

I’m Anja Sammon, the designer behind JulchenKnits. I trained as a tailor in my native Germany and now work as Art teacher in a public school on the West coast of Ireland.

Watching my mum knit as a child seemed like magic to me. She taught me how to knit when I was seven years old, and this is where my website name “Julchen knits” was born: “Julchen”(or “Yool-hen”) is a German pet name for mischievous little girls, and as I would often be seen with my knitting perched on the kitchen counter, someone would surely say “Guck, Julchen strickt wieder!” – “Look, Julchen knits again!”

2022 was my “Brioche Year”, taking inspiration from art historical designs with prominant lines and textures. This year, in 2023, I am researching traditional stitch patterns and colour combinations from my local area in Germany, which has some of the oldest “Trachten” on record, and combine these with our Irish Aran stitches.

Knitting for me is all about community, fun and trying something new each day. Please get in touch at any time to ask questions, suggest ideas, collab, or simply to chat. I would love to hear from you.

Happy knitting! :)

7297114.name: Foongus Fidget
7297114.notes_html:
This pattern is intended for personal use only. (Not mass production). You may sell the finished items you have made from this pattern, but please give credit where it’s due to Maple Stitcher as the designer. No portion (text or images) may be reproduced, transmitted or distributed by any means without expressed permission from Maple Stitcher.

This first half of the pattern is the exact same pattern as the one below, but without the added pictures for those that simply just want the written pattern with the complete picture up top.

Requirements:
Hook: 4.5mm (6.5mm for blanket yarn)
Yarn: big twist value or red heart super saver in red (purple for shiny), black, and white
Handful of stuffing
Tools: Yarn needle & scissors
12mm oval safety eyes (optional), use whatever you have on hand or works best for you

7316118.name: Sensory Fidget Blanket - Barnyard Scene
7316118.gauge_description: 8 stitches and 13 rows = 4 inches in stockinette with 8 mm knitting needles
7316118.notes_html:
A sensory fidget blanket with a variety of sensory activities:

  • A barnhouse with openable windows and doors to reveal barn animals,
  • A garden patch with curly springy carrot leaves and “harvestable” mushrooms and radishes,
  • A zippered toolbox to reveal a handheld spade and rake,
  • A bunch of flowers with insertable buttons, moveable beads, and frilly petals,
  • A tree with fruits hanging on buttons,
  • A sky with a sun with movable beads and a textured cloud that can be flipped to reveal a cardinal and a blue jay.

Blanket base is knitted with a simple crochet border. Written knitting and crochet instructions.

Appliques are crocheted, in written American English crochet pattern.

Dimensions: 120 cm square blanket

Suggested yarn:

  • Weight 6 Super Bulky for blanket base
  • Weight 3 Light/DK and Weight 4 Medium for appliques
7316118.notes:
A sensory fidget blanket with a variety of sensory activities:
- A barnhouse with openable windows and doors to reveal barn animals,
- A garden patch with curly springy carrot leaves and “harvestable” mushrooms and radishes,
- A zippered toolbox to reveal a handheld spade and rake,
- A bunch of flowers with insertable buttons, moveable beads, and frilly petals,
- A tree with fruits hanging on buttons,
- A sky with a sun with movable beads and a textured cloud that can be flipped to reveal a cardinal and a blue jay.

Blanket base is knitted with a simple crochet border. Written knitting and crochet instructions.

Appliques are crocheted, in written American English crochet pattern.

Dimensions: 120 cm square blanket

Suggested yarn:
- Weight 6 Super Bulky for blanket base
- Weight 3 Light/DK and Weight 4 Medium for appliques

7317353.name: Luv U 4ever Fidget
7317353.notes_html:
The Luv U 4ever fidget pattern combines crochet heart shapes with a continuous mobius strip to create a fidget that pops out hearts forever and ever!

This is a silent fidget toy, which is great for stimming and anxiety. <3

  • This pattern includes the Mobius Strip technique.
  • The pattern expects you to know all basic crochet stitches. It teaches you how to colour change, crochet a exdc, and how to create the mobius strip shape.
  • Recommended for intermediate crocheters
  • Includes lots of photos and detailed written explanations!
  • Pattern is written using US terminology
  • finished fidget is about 4” in diameter if you follow the recommended repeats. The fidget can easily be made larger by starting with a longer foundation ch.
  • Instructions for BOTH right-hand and left-hand crocheters! You will receive 2 pdf downloads upon purchase; there will be one for the LH version, and one pdf for the RH version.

Materials needed:

  • 5mm crochet hook (H)
  • colour 1 - approx. 30 yards of weight 4 acrylic yarn
  • colour 2 - approx. 80-100 yards of weight 4 acrylic yarn
  • st marker
  • needle
7317353.notes:
The Luv U 4ever fidget pattern combines crochet heart shapes with a continuous mobius strip to create a fidget that pops out hearts forever and ever!

This is a silent fidget toy, which is great for stimming and anxiety. <3

- This pattern includes the Mobius Strip technique.
- The pattern expects you to know all basic crochet stitches. It teaches you how to colour change, crochet a exdc, and how to create the mobius strip shape. 
- Recommended for intermediate crocheters
- Includes lots of photos and detailed written explanations! 
- Pattern is written using US terminology
- finished fidget is about 4" in diameter if you follow the recommended repeats. The fidget can easily be made larger by starting with a longer foundation ch.
- Instructions for BOTH right-hand and left-hand crocheters! You will receive 2 pdf downloads upon purchase; there will be one for the LH version, and one pdf for the RH version.

Materials needed:

- st marker
- needle

7326922.name: Boob/Breast
7326922.notes_html:
Crochet pattern for a boob/breast to accompany the Breastfeeding demonstration puppet (also available on my Ravelry shop here.

Ideal for breastfeeding consultants, support volunteer, infant feeding support workers, doulas, NCT instructors etc.

This pattern is written in English uses US crochet terms.
Difficulty – advanced beginner

Materials list:
I recommend using either DK (light #3) or aran (worsted #4) yarn and a 4mm hook for DK or a 5mm hook for aran. You will need 2 colours - a small scrap for the nipple and around 15g-20g (approx. 50-70 yards) for the boob colour.
10-20g toy stuffing
Scissors
Darning needle

Items made from this pattern may be sold online, in small quantities, crediting me as the designer.

Crochet pattern for a boob/breast to accompany the Breastfeeding demonstration puppet (also available on my Ravelry shop [here][1].

Ideal for breastfeeding consultants, support volunteer, infant feeding support workers, doulas, NCT instructors etc.

This pattern is written in English uses US crochet terms.

Materials list:

It means I get more time at home with my little boy but I also get to earn a living doing something I love!

7328508.name: Knitted Fidget Toy
7328508.notes_html:
This toy is great for kids (and adults) who need something to quietly fidget with. I recommend using a yarn that can be easily washed

This toy is knitted flat and then the edges are attached at the end. You can use straight needles or circular needles, depending on how large you choose to make the toy

I would recommend this project for the beginner to intermediate levels

7329303.gauge_pattern: sc, 5 mm crochet hook, Weight 4 yarn
7329303.name: Sensory Fidget Blanket - Nautical Themed
7329303.gauge_description: 14 stitches and 18 rows = 4 inches in sc, 5 mm crochet hook, Weight 4 yarn
7329303.notes_html:
A sensory fidget blanket with a variety of sensory activities:

  • A treasure chest with a zipper to store various golden treasures and string of jewelry
  • A seashell that reveals hidden pearls
  • A net where a crab is hiding
  • Buttons for “flippable” sailboat sail
  • Buttons and rings for interactive movable sea creatures
  • Cords available for tying various sailor’s knots
  • Textured fabrics, like layers of fish scales, frilly octopus tentacles, and soft chenille seaweed
  • Bright colours on the different nautical flags
  • Sliding beads on the lifesaver and string of buoys

Comprised of 25 different 20-cm-squares, some are knitted and some are crocheted. Border around blanket is crocheted. Written knitting and crochet (American English crochet) instructions, with assembly diagrams.

Dimensions: ~100 cm square blanket

Uses a mix of yarn:

  • Weight 1 Superfine
  • Weight 3 Light/DK
  • Weight 4 Medium
  • Weight 5 Bulky
  • Weight 6 Super Bulky

7341149.name: Stressfriends
7341149.notes_html:
No-Sew!
English pattern with US terms

Feeling stressed out?

These stressfriends are addictive and awesome to make and or use!
They work up quicly (less than 30 min each), and are great for scraps!

You will need a fidget/squeeze/blowbubble for each of them in size small (direct link to where I got mine is provided in the pattern), and you will also need googley eyes/finger puppet for Mr.Giggles (direct link is also provided for this)

I like to use 10 mm felt eyes on mine, but you can also chose to use safety eyes if you flatten the back of them.

Super popular at markets!

7344384.name: Pebble Ring Fidget
7344384.notes_html:
This is a great pattern for using up scrap yarn or whatever you have laying around.

This pattern is 4 pages (including a cover page), with step by step instructions and photos so you can make your own Pebble Ring Fidget.

Using the supplies listed below, my fidget turned out to be about 2.5 inches in diameter using the supplies listed below.

Patterns aren’t refundable, but I’m happy to help if you have any questions, so please feel free to reach out if you need.

Supplies:
5mm hook
6mm hook

Glass Pebble:
This will be flat on one side and rounded on the other.
Sometimes they’re called glass aquarium beads.

Yarn Needle for sewing in ends
Scissors

I Love This Cotton:
Color of your choice
I prefer the prints they have in this cotton

packs.yarn_name: Hobby Lobby I Love This Cotton! Print

7349459.name: Mushroom Fidget Base
7349459.notes_html:
This is a written crochet pattern for a small basic mushroom fidget with two different shaped cap options! This is the basic shape of all the mushies I make into synesthesia pieces! A glass gem and the cap make great tactile and silent fidgets.

Required materials:
Scrap amounts of yarn in any weight (10-20g) and a hook to match.
A Glass Cabachon Gem, the kind that’s often used as vase filler or fireplace filler. You can also use a glass marble or any other smooth small thing that fits in your mushroom’s stem.

Using US terminology, here’s a list of included stitches and terms.
Magic Circle, Chain, Slip Stitch, Single Crochet, Increase, Decrease, Double Crochet, Front Post DC, Back Post DC, Back Loop Only and Front Loop Only.

While this is a text-only pattern right now, it’s priced to reflect that and I have plans to update it to a photo tutorial in the future!

I’d love to see what you create with this pattern! Share on Tiktok, Instagram or tumblr using #therestlesswitch and tag me, @therestlesswitch. You can find custom crochet pieces and more patterns in my Shop!.

users.about_me:
Hello all!  I'm a folk herbalist, podcaster, blogger, animal and nature enthusiast, witchy, crochet artist, and gardener! I tend to go through phases of either crafting and crocheting for hours a day, or not at all for weeks at a time. Nature and the seasons are so important to me and my phases do tend to have seasonal correspondence. Winter = crocheting all day every day, Spring = gardening, summer = herbalism and gardening, Autumn = DO ALL THE THINGS.

Website: therestlesswitch.com
Podcast: 0Witchcraft for the Restless (hosted on anchor, find it on most podcast platforms

7356436.name: Stress Balls
7356436.notes_html:
Beginner Pattern

Abbreviations (US)

MR: Magic ring
Sc: Single crochet
Inc: Increase
Dec: Decrease
Rnd: Round
FO: Fasten off
st/sts: stitch/stitches
Bobble st: For this stitch you will yarn over, insert the hook into the next stitch, yarn over & pull through, yarn over and pull through the first 2 loops, yarn over & insert hook into the same stitch, pull through, yarn over & pull through 2 loops. This process will be repeated 3 or 4 times and you will end up with 4 or 5 loops on your hook. Yarn over & pull through all of the loops on the hook.
(…) x: Repeat stitches in brackets x amount of times
Stitch total at end of round is shown in square brackets

Tools and Materials:

1 Skein acrylic weight 4 yarn in emerald green, white and fuchsia yarn. Pink and black thread for embroidery
4mm Crochet hook
Tapestry needle and scissors
Polyester fiber fill stuffing
7.5” squishy ball of any kind/or stuffing. If you use different size yarn you might need a different size ball.
Sewing pins
Stitch marker

Notes:

Pattern is worked in continuous rounds, unless specified otherwise.
Use a stitch marker or piece of yarn to keep track of the last stitch in each round.
When filling with polyester stuffing, pull apart large chunks into smaller chunks and fill sides of piece first and middle last. This ensures an even distribution of firmness within the amigurumi.
7356436.notes:
**Beginner Pattern**

Abbreviations (US)

MR: Magic ring
Sc: Single crochet
Inc: Increase
Dec: Decrease
Rnd: Round
FO: Fasten off
st/sts: stitch/stitches
Bobble st: For this stitch you will yarn over, insert the hook into the next stitch, yarn over & pull through, yarn over and pull through the first 2 loops, yarn over & insert hook into the same stitch, pull through, yarn over & pull through 2 loops. This process will be repeated 3 or 4 times and you will end up with 4 or 5 loops on your hook. Yarn over & pull through all of the loops on the hook.
(...) x: Repeat stitches in brackets x amount of times
Stitch total at end of round is shown in [square] brackets

Tools and Materials: 

1 Skein acrylic weight 4 yarn in emerald green, white and fuchsia yarn. Pink and black thread for embroidery
4mm Crochet hook
Tapestry needle and scissors
Polyester fiber fill stuffing
7.5" squishy ball of any kind/or stuffing. If you use different size yarn you might need a different size ball.
Sewing pins
Stitch marker

Notes:

Pattern is worked in continuous rounds, unless specified otherwise. 
Use a stitch marker or piece of yarn to keep track of the last stitch in each round.
When filling with polyester stuffing, pull apart large chunks into smaller chunks and fill sides of piece first and middle last. This ensures an even distribution of firmness within the amigurumi.

pattern_author.name: Crochet Kitty Corner
pattern_author.notes:
Hi everyone! Welcome to my little crochet corner. My love of crochet started a few years ago and I never looked back. I hope that my patterns will bring you as much enjoyment crocheting as it did for me. 

Don't forget to check back often as I am always adding more

Thank you for stopping by !

users.about_me:
Welcome to Crochet Kitty Corner, where creativity and coziness come together in the form of delightful amigurumi crochet patterns. I wanted to share my love of amigurumi with others by designing patterns so that crocheting could be a fun and accessible experience for everyone. Let's spread the love of crochet together—one adorable creation at a time!  
Thank you for choosing Crochet Kitty Corner as your go-to destination for amigurumi patterns that inspire creativity and spread smiles. Happy stitching!

IF YOU HAVE ANY QUESTIONS FOR ANY OF MY PATTERNS DON'T HESITATE TO MESSAGE ME ON SOCIALS OR EMAIL.

 I am always adding more patterns !

***Patterns are not refundable***
